sentence.Network_en: He was miraculously healed of a severe fever.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的高烧奇迹般地退了。

sentence.Network_en: We miraculously survived the crossing to Muscat.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们奇迹般地活着来到了马斯喀特。

sentence.Network_en: Miraculously, the guards escaped death or serious injury.
sentence.Network_cn: 警卫们奇迹般地死里逃生，也没有受重伤。

刘一男重点单词串讲记录 - 豆丁网 ... marine 舰队, 水兵, 海运业 miraculous 奇迹的, 不可思议的 mirror 镜子.

entry.tran: 神奇的;奇迹般的;不可思议的
entry.def: If you describe a good event as miraculous, you mean that it is very surprising and unexpected.

example.ex: The horse made a miraculous recovery to finish a close third.
example.tran: 这匹马奇迹般地恢复了状态，以微弱的劣势位居第三。

entry.def: If someone describes a wonderful event as miraculous, they believe that the event was caused by God.

sentences.sentence: "my hand grasped the gun that was, miraculously, lying on the ground beside my finger tips"

auth_sentence.content: She was burned alive and came out miraculously unharmed.
auth_sentence.res_content: She was burned alive and came out miraculously unharmed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She was burned alive and came out miraculously unharmed.

auth_sentence.content: But the menorah miraculously stayed alight for eight days.
auth_sentence.res_content: But the menorah miraculously stayed alight for eight days.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But the menorah miraculously stayed alight for eight days.

auth_sentence.content: A first-class library...miraculously preserved throughout all her peregrinations.
auth_sentence.res_content: A first-class library...miraculously preserved throughout all her peregrinations.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A first-class library...miraculously preserved throughout all her peregrinations.

means.word_mean: 神奇地;非凡地;出乎意料地

sentences.en: He had been miraculously saved from almost certain death.
sentences.cn: 他奇迹般地从死亡线上获救。

sentences.en: A schoolboy miraculously survived a 25 000-volt electric shock.
sentences.cn: 一名男学生在遭受2.5 万伏的电击后奇迹般地活了下来。
